backgroundRationale: This supports routine O&M actions and emergency IPTDS repair for Snake River and Upper Columbia River salmonid population escapement and distribution.

sampleDesigns.title: Task 2: Operate and Maintain ISEMP IPTDS. - Quantitative Consultants Inc 1, cloned for Study Plan 74
Task 5: Lower Granite Dam adult spring/summer Chinook salmon and steelhead scale ageing. - Quantitative Consultants Inc 1, cloned for Study Plan 74
Operate and maintain PIT tag arrays - Washington Department of Fish and Wildlife (WDFW): ISEMP Protocol , cloned for Study Plan 74
Task 6: Lower Granite Dam adult and tributary juvenile salmonid scale analysis - Quantitative Consultants Inc 1, cloned for Study Plan 74
Task 3: Operate and Maintain ISEMP IPTDS. - Quantitative Consultants Inc, cloned for Study Plan 74
Develop and test methods to calculate instantaneous and periodic PIT tag array efficiency. - Quantitative Consultants Inc, cloned for Study Plan 74
Adult Salmon Steelhead Tributary Escapement and Distribution Estimation (BioMark)

keyAssumptions:
1. Unbiased collection of fish at Lower Granite Dam Ladder Trap
2. Unbiased wild/hatchery designation of unmarked, non-tagged adult salmon and steelhead
dataHandlingConsiderations: Data of array operation goes to Biomark Datamanager and is passed onto PTAGIS. While Array detections are managed in PTAGIS
qualityControlConsiderations: Manual data is rechecked by technicians after entry. Automatic data is checked using standardized queries that check for correct formatting and missing data (temporal).
reportingConsiderations: Data from PIT deterction systems are automatically uploaded to PTAGIS daily. Manual data is entered and uploaded weekly to PTAGIS. Scale ages and associated trap data is reported on a weekly to monthly scale.
name: Adult Salmon Steelhead Tributary Escapement and Distribution Estimation
